com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.oauth2

Class DeviceCodeTokenProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.oauth2.AccessTokenProvider
      • com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.oauth2.DeviceCodeTokenProvider

  • public class DeviceCodeTokenProvider
extends AccessTokenProvider
    Enables interactive login in non-browser based contexts. Displays a message asking the user to login using the browser, using the provided link and code.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeviceCodeTokenProvider

        public DeviceCodeTokenProvider(String appId)
                        throws IOException
        Prompts user to log in and constructs a tokenProvider based on the refresh token obtained from the login.
        Parameters:
        appId - the app ID whose name Azure AD will display on the login screen
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of errors

      • DeviceCodeTokenProvider

        public DeviceCodeTokenProvider(String appId,
                               com.microsoft.azure.datalake.store.oauth2.DeviceCodeCallback callback)
                        throws IOException
        Prompts user to log in and constructs a tokenProvider based on the refresh token obtained from the login.
        Parameters:
        appId - the app ID whose name Azure AD will display on the login screen. Can be null. If not provided, a default appId will be used.
        callback - callback that can display the message to the user on how to login. Can be null. If not provided, the default callback will be used which diplays the message on standard output.
        Throws:
        IOException - in case of errors

    • Method Detail

      • refreshToken

        protected AzureADToken refreshToken()
                             throws IOException
        Description copied from class: AccessTokenProvider
        the method to fetch the access token. Derived classes should override this method to actually get the token from Azure Active Directory.

        This method will be called initially, and then once when the token is about to expire.

        Specified by:
        refreshToken in class AccessTokenProvider
        Returns:
        AzureADToken containing the access token
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is an error fetching the token

      • getRefreshToken

        public String getRefreshToken()
